---
title: "Chapter 5 Notes"
author: Robert Reiss
date: 9-15-24
---

 
## Notes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Import data
weather <- read.csv("https://mac-stat.github.io/data/weather_3_locations.csv") %>% 
  mutate(date = as.Date(date))  

# Check out the first 6 rows
# What are the units of observation?
# humidity, rain levels, rainbow, temperature, pressure, etc

# How many data points do we have? 
# 2367

# What type of variables do we have?
# categorical and numerical
```
:::


# Plot to examine temp3pm

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(weather, aes(x = temp3pm))+geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 19 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_bin()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Afternoon temp by location


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot 1 (no facets & starting from a density plot of temp3pm)
ggplot(weather, aes(x = temp3pm)) + 
  geom_density()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 19 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_density()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Location = only Wollongong

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
woll <- weather %>%
  filter(location == "Wollongong") %>% 
  mutate(date = as.Date(date))  

# How often does it raintoday?
# Fill your geometric layer with the color blue.
ggplot(woll, aes(x = raintoday))+geom_bar(fill = "lightblue")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Now compare different approaches

# Default: stacked bars
ggplot(woll, aes(x = raintoday, fill = raintomorrow)) + 
  geom_bar()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Side-by-side bars
ggplot(woll, aes(x = raintoday, fill = raintomorrow)) + 
  geom_bar(position = "dodge")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Proportional bars
# position = "fill" refers to filling the frame, nothing to do with the color-related fill
ggplot(woll, aes(x = raintoday, fill = raintomorrow)) + 
  geom_bar(position = "fill")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-4.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Example 4

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(weather, aes(y = temp3pm, x = date))+geom_line()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

## Example 5

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot temp3pm vs temp9am
# Change the code in order to indicate the location to which each data point corresponds
ggplot(weather, aes(y = temp3pm, x = temp9am)) + 
  geom_point("Hobart" = "lightblue", "Uluru" = "lightgreen", "Wollongong" = "lightyellow")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning in geom_point(Hobart = "lightblue", Uluru = "lightgreen", Wollongong =
"lightyellow"): Ignoring unknown parameters: `Hobart`, `Uluru`, and
`Wollongong`
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 27 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](9_16_24_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
